p: The following menus are available in Turn Watcher™:
The File menu let's you manage your lists of characters. You can Import, Export and Clear your lists. And once you are finished with the software, you can Quit.

Import a previously exported list of characters and monsters. This menu entry opens the import dialog with a list of directories and files. By default, the Turn Watcher™ filter will be turned on so you will only see files compatible with Turn Watcher™.
You can browse your hard drives by double clicking on directories on the left or the right list. Once you find the file you want to import, double click on it.

In the import window, you can drag and drop a directory from the list on the right to the list on the left. The directory will then be accessible with just a double click each time you open the importer.

The current list of characters and monsters is automatically saved for you every 5 seconds (unless it didn't change). If you quit and come back, you will see the same characters already there. In other words, you do not need to worry about saving your characters.

Yet, at times, it is necessary to have different sets of characters (for Dungeons Masters who handle different parties of characters.) For this purpose, you can Export the current list of characters and monsters for later importing of that list.

This menu entry opens the export dialog with a place to type the name of a file. By default, it only shows you in which directory the file will be saved. You can also click on the Browse for other folders button to browse your hard disk in case you want to save your file in a very specific place. The browser of the Export dialog is the same as the browser of the Import dialog.
The Export function creates a Turn Watcher™ file with the extension turnwatcher1 (tw1 under Microsoft Windows.)

p.i: Click to enlarge and see the expanded export dialog

p: Clear the list of characters and monsters. This is very useful if you are changing compain and you want to enter new characters in Turn Watcher™.
Warning: you cannot undo the clearing of your lists; you want to first Export your actual list if you are to re-use it later.

Select this menu entry to quit the application. Your list of characters and monsters will automatically be saved so the next time you start your application, you get all of your characters and monsters back the way they were when you quit.

The Edit menu offers the Undo and Redo features which let you under and redo pretty much anything you do with Turn Watcher™. The Edit menu also let's you Add, Edit and Delete characters and monsters from your current list.
Turn Watcher™ records all your actions so you can undo them later. This includes all the management of the characters, the dice rolls, the rounds tracker, etc.
The edit menu will show you a label which includes what will be undone. For instance, if you roll initiative, the menu will tell you Undo Initiative Roll.
Any action that you can undo can also be redone. This is very useful if you select undo a few more times than you wanted.
Like the Undo action, the Redo action will tell you what it can redo.
Warning: you lose the capability of redoing things as soon as you do any action other than undo or redo.

The Rounds menu lets you manage a round. Before to be in Round mode, you need to Start. Once started, you can go Next, Delay a character or a monster, have them Jump In later, and enter Damage to your characters and monsters.
The Roll menu lets you roll dice for Initiative, Spot, Listen and Will.
